paralyse.translation[0].definitions[0].d: if something paralyses you, it makes you lose the ability to move part or all of your body, or to feel it
paralyse.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Her legs were partly paralysed in the crash.
paralyse.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to make something unable to operate normally
paralyse.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Fear of unemployment is paralysing the economy.
Motor traffic was paralysed in much of the city.
